results.title: Dad's goanna
results.brief_description:
One of two stories in MAP about the stuffed animal displays in the Murtoa Museum. In this short doco, Meryl Duder talks about her life in Murtoa as a young girl of 10, relating the tale of “dad’s goanna” and how it ended up preserved in Mr Hill’s house in Murtoa in a room full of many other stuffed animals. Years later, on returning to Murtoa with her daughter and to the Murtoa Museum, Meryl was delighted to be able to point out and say “there’s dad’s goanna”.
Filmed by Malcolm McKinnon and made with the assistance of Murtoa Historical Society and Murtoa Lions Club.
The James Hill Bird Collection is held by the Lions Club of Murtoa under a special scientific license.

results.title: Dad's Girl/Common Ground
results.creator_credit: Martin Daley, Judy Menczel, Pamela Williams and Ron Saunders
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Breakthrough series”.
In “Dad’s Girl” we meet Janea who lives with her mother and still misses her father years after the divorce. She discusses the effect of her parents’ divorce on her life. In “Common Ground”, Sean’s experience of his parents’ divorce and his new step-father are shown along with the changes he makes to adapt to his new family situation.

results.title: Dad's army: Turkey dinner. Ring dem bells. When you've got to go
results.brief_description: Popular comic English television program “Dad’s army”, which ran for nine years, is about numerous men that comprise the local division of the Home Guard in the seaside town of Walmington-on-Sea during World War 2. The men are an eccentric lot who range in age from the very young to the decidedly doddery. In each episode the group muddle their way through a different situation in their own idiosyncratic way. Episodes include: “Turkey dinner” (30 mins, 1974) When Corporal Jones is left holding a dead turkey after the platoon’s drunken night-watch, Mainwaring decides to treat the town’s senior citizens to a feast. “Ring dem bells” (30 mins, 1975) Mainwaring is not pleased when his platoon is chosen to play Nazis in an Army film and Pike is selected to play a German officer. “When you’ve got to go” (1975, 30 mins) Despite his bad chest, sinuses and weak ankles, Pike is passed A1 on his medical.

results.title: Dad's army: Is there honey still for tea? Come in your time is up. High Finance
results.brief_description: Popular comic English television program “Dad’s army”, which ran for nine years, is about numerous men that comprise the local division of the Home Guard in the seaside town of Walmington-on-Sea during World War 2. The men are an eccentric lot who range in age from the very young to the decidedly doddery. In each episode the group muddle their way through a different situation in their own idiosyncratic way. Episodes include: “Is there honey still for tea?” (1975, 30 mins) Private Godfrey’s cottage is condemned to be bulldozed because a new airstrip is to be built. “Come in your time is up” (1975, 31 mins) Mainwaring’s platoon discovers a German crew in a dinghy on a lake and endeavour to bring them to shore. “High finance” (1975, 31 mins) Mainwaring decides that Jones’ bank account has been in the red too long.

results.title: D.W. Griffith: father of film
results.creator_credit: David Gill, Kevin Brownlow, Thames Television and Channel Four
results.brief_description: A three part survey of the life and work of D.W. Griffith. His formative years in the theatre and at Biograph were followed by his major successes between 1915-1921: “The Birth of a nation”, “Broken blossoms”, “Way down east” and “Orphans of the storm”. The subsequently influential “Intolerance” was a critical and commercial failure prefiguring the failure, in the twenties, of “America”, “Isn’t life wonderful” and “The Sorrows of Satan” and later, of his neglected sound films, “Abraham Lincoln” and “The Struggle”. Brownlow and Gill make extensive use of colour-tinted extracts from his films and interviews with Lillian Gish, Blanche Sweet, Karl Brown and others. Narrated by Lindsay Anderson.

results.title: D.P.: Displaced Person
results.creator_credit: Alan Bridges, Barry Levinson and HTV
results.brief_description: Based on the story by Kurt Vonnegut Jnr, author of Breakfast of Champions and Slaughterhouse Five. It’s the aftermath of the world’s greatest war. Allied occupied Germany, ravaged and shamed in defeat, must now pick up the pieces. One of those pieces is a small black orphan boy named Tobias. Abandoned at a cold and dismal orphanage, he dreams - despite jeers from the other embittered children - of his courageous father’s return from war to claim him. When Tobias meets his first black man, he’s convinced the G.I. sergeant is the father of his dreams.

results.title: D.O.A = DOA
results.creator_credit: Rudolph Mate, Leo Popkin and Cardinal Film
results.brief_description: This fast paced exciting crime story was originally released as a B-movie filler but has, through the years, acquired a reputation as one of the most effective and most impressive of Hollywood film noir. Edmond O’Brien plays an insurance man, unsure about his life and his feelings for his girlfriend Paula (Pamela Britten), who on a weekend trip to San Francisco finds himself the victim of a bizarre poisoning. His attempts to unravel the mystery while counting down the clock to his death lead him to a reappreciation of his own life. Directed by Rudolph Mate who was the cinematographer for Carl Dreyer’s “The Passion of Joan of Arc” and “Vampyr”, the highly evocative cinematography, chilling musical score by Dimitri Tiomkin, and the desperate central performance by O’Brien all contribute to making this a truly suspenseful and dark piece of filmmaking.

results.title: D.E.B.S.
results.brief_description: A quartet of girls from a prep high school are recruited by a secret paramilitary academy to conduct cloak-and-dagger missions. Short film later expanded into a feature film with the same name.

constellations_other.name: Thomas Edison
constellations_other.description: Thomas Edison helped establish cinema as an art-form and mass entertainment. Many of his early films were short and showed everyday activities like riding a bicycle.

results.title: D. H. Lawrence: poet and novelist, 1885-1930
results.brief_description: A biography of the English writer David Herbert Lawrence which examines the influence of his birthplace, family and sexual relationships on his writing, poetry and paintings. Born to a mining family, Lawrence’s early life was dominated by his parents’ antagonistic relationship which would form the basis for one of his finest novels, “Sons and Lovers”. His own personal life was to be chaotic and undisciplined until he met and married the German Freda, who though passionate and unpredictable, was to encourage his writing and intellectual growth. Using archival photographs and documents the video explores Lawrence’s travels, his politics, his battles with censors, and most significantly, his writing.
